channel.title: Victor Villa's News
channel.description: The combined feed of my online stuff.

item.title: No title
item.description:
Instagram import fails silently for posts with videos. Can‚Äôt post a new video because it‚Äôs HEIC (almost everything on my phone is nowadays?), and the app doesn‚Äôt support videos at all yet.

Pixelfed meets my photography needs - not many - but it‚Äôs really not there as an Instagram replacement for the social part. Hoping it gets there soon, don‚Äôt wanna see a ‚Äúbluesky but for photos and short videos‚Äù show up. Maybe I should be trying loops.video instead?

item.title: No title
item.description:
The issue was that Safari unzips the export automatically, and simply compressing it back doesn‚Äôt perfectly reverse the operation.

Downloaded the export with Firefox and things just worked.

item.title: No title
item.description:
#Portuguese might not be the among the most relevant languages of the world economy, but #Brazilians go hard on social networks so I like to think we're a meaningful audience to think about.

With that in mind... I wish #fediverse developers knew that "fedi" in Portuguese pronunciation sounds like "stinks", so a website like #Pixelfed literally sounds like "pixel stinks".

It doesn't sound similar to, it sounds exactly so. I will never not be embarrassed of saying Pixelfed out loud to family.

item.title: No title
item.description:
Found a clue here: https://github.com/pixelfed/pixelfed/pull/5510

"The export may contain files in the webp or heic file formats, this media is not supported"

But looks like there are other issues involved: https://github.com/pixelfed/pixelfed/issues/5114

item.title: No title
item.description:
Any #pixelfed wizard out there knows what's up with Instagram import? Can't make it work for the life of me, it's a fresh IG export, v0.12.4 Pixelfed instance. All I get is "Invalid import archive".

Looks like this issue is common but I found no reproducible workarounds out there.

item.title: No title
item.description:
I was hoping to self host before migrating to minimize how many times I migrate accounts, but I can‚Äôt keep supporting Meta just because it takes me ages to figure out how to build Pixelfed images :-)

So https://pxlfd.ca/victor is my new home for oversharing moments and amateurish photography üéâ hit me up over there or reply with your profile so I can populate my feed with the right people üôè

#SocialBC

How much of a dirtbag you need to be to cause your lawyer to fire you as a client and smear your name?

This guy probably has a hundred times the capacity for self censorship than that of the average human being and he still chose to lead with that. https://infosec.exchange/@kurtseifried/113828141997311874

item.title: No title
item.description:
This week has been a big ‚ÄúI told you so‚Äù moment for all the #fediverse admins that defederated #threads from the get go due to moderation concerns.

And it‚Äôs sad to think that eventually the naysayers will get the marks on Bluesky too.

item.title: No title
item.description: #Questrade running YouTube ads telling me that renting a condo (instead of buying a house with a yard) is for suckers. For a company that tries to self position in opposition to the big banks, they sure are holding hands in financial illiteracy.

item.title: No title
item.description:
Sounds simple, right? But I only know of one: Monk Mode (https://apps.apple.com/ca/app/monk-mode/id1561444285). It‚Äôs fine and works for me, but it‚Äôs abandoned and would be nice to have a modern version with promising app intents, shortcuts and/or Siri.

#ios #technology (2/2)

item.title: No title
item.description: Anyone recommends an #AppleWatch #meditation app that‚Äôs not subscription-based? Something I can do a one time purchase and the only feature that matters is that I can start a timer and when completed the data is added to Apple Health. I don‚Äôt even care about heart monitoring data. I only want the mindful minutes counting. (1/2)

item.title: No title
item.description: What a weird bug in #iOS Shortcuts: the Speak text action "Rate" parameter only affects the first _sentence_ of a text. So if I pass it "Good morning! Have a great day!", setting the rate to the lowest value only slows down the "good morning" part ü•¥

item.title: No title
item.description:
The #riddle of private property

No lock guards me, yet none can steal.
My weight is yours alone to feel.

No force can strike me from your name,
No law can alter what‚Äôs the same.
Passing years can't do me ill.
Immutable, yours to shape at will.

Who am I?

item.title: No title
item.description: #QuartaCapa livros para dar de presente, os melhores pra mim s√£o os de mesa. Meu favorito √© o ‚ÄúAm I Overthinking This?‚Äù de Michelle Rial, sucesso instant√¢neo com todo mundo que folheou.

item.title: No title
item.description:
#TerCinema de Natal

It‚Äôs Christmas Eve in Tinseltown and Sin-Dee is back on the block. Upon hearing that her pimp boyfriend hasn‚Äôt been faithful during the 28 days she was locked up, the working girl and her best friend, Alexandra, embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor. Their rip-roaring odyssey leads them through various subcultures of Los Angeles, including an Armenian family dealing with their own repercussions of infidelity.

https://letterboxd.com/film/tangerine/
